website_summaries.verdict: A simple plug-and-play desktop solution with excellent WiFi range.
pros: This model’s 2 high-rise antennas, 4 gigabit Ethernet ports, compatibility with all routers, and 10,000 square-foot range make it a versatile device that easily delivers WiFi throughout your home
cons: The RE6500 AC1200 model is similar and less expensive, but lacks the longer antenna of this version

customer_reviews.title: easy set up,  works incredible in just minutes
customer_reviews.text: -literally plugged it in, waited till the light turned solid, connected to my computer, started Chrome browser, it initiated set up, put in my password - boom, done. total set up time maybe 3 mins. -went from getting between 10-50mbps speed with just my router to now getting 140-160mbps speed (my router puts out 150mbps speed but is a distance away, through many walls-hence this extender) -its surprisingly small, takes up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: Thatidiottibor

customer_reviews.title: Signal is great one minute
customer_reviews.text: I have not been impressed with this. I can be sitting right next to it and it does not come up as available. Signal is great one minute, then nothing the next. I am constantly resetting it and still nothing. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: tnmom2amk

customer_reviews.title: This one was super simple. I was amazed at how quick I ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used a two other range extenders, and both were a PITA to set up. This one was super simple. I was amazed at how quick I had it up, running, and secured within my network (about 3 or 4 minutes). Range is solid too. I put my at the edge of my existing network (which means my kitchen) and it goes all the way out to the entire deck (about another 75 feet through an exterior wall) and down through the floor and another exterior wall into the garage area. So far I have not had any problems with transitions between the two systems, it appears to be pretty seamless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Android Users Beware
customer_reviews.text: There's a software glitch with this device that makes it impossible to use Netflix from an android device while this range extender is plugged in. I have a regular router and bought this to increase the signal range in my home. If this device is plugged in, it causes Netflix to crash on any android device immediately as it's opened. I have my regular router named a different network name than the extended network. It will happen even when not connected to the extander. As soon as I unplug the extender from the wall Netflix will work. I have done much gooogling on this issue and there is no fix for it.
customer_reviews.author: Vinceta

customer_reviews.title: Extremely frustrated, I mean extremely
customer_reviews.text: Owned it less than a year, working ok at first but lately dropping connection to the other router and requires rebooting at least once a day. Today I tried updating firmware and it looks like it has bricked itself. TECH support did finally answer the phone and as it is still under warranty they did not charge for the call as they did on another Linksys product I own. It took two long calls of script-driven troubleshooting before they agreed to replace it. I also own the EA4500 router which has its problems. I'm not planning to buy any more Linksys devices.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Chadbourne

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  If there is trouble setting this up look for Retired Guy's review.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and on time. Works great. No more dead spots and great speed anywhere in my home. Great product and easy to set up. If anybody is having trouble and not tech savvy I suggest to find the review on the product page done by Retired Guy. Being in IT, tech is easy for me to understand and like Retired Guy said the quick set up contained in the box needs to contain more precise info for the average person. Thanks again Retired Guy and to the seller. Great product for its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Grover

customer_reviews.title: Not updated and signal drops every day.
customer_reviews.text: I give it 2 stars overall because I had to call amazon multiple times about this product on the phone with them for hours trying to resolve its issue. Each time they transferred me to linkskys tech support. They are sending out non updated units. So the connection drops I kid you not every single night AND day. So I have to reboot each time to get it back on. It’s silly. The update doesn’t help either if you can get it updated (requires a physical connection to a computer to do so).
customer_reviews.author: Trinny

customer_reviews.title: Plugged in going on year 3 outside hasn't stopped working.  Zero issues.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this going on 3 years ago to extend signal for our customers at an RV park. Covers about 500 square yards. I've connected to it up to a quarter mile away during testing. Yes, it cuts bandwidth in half, but that's better than NO signal. We pay for 200Mbps from our isp. This cuts that down to around 100, but have had 10+ customers connected to it for years streaming, surfing, and gaming without problems. I have it mounted in a plastic box 10ft above ground on a pole. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: The Gibbonator

customer_reviews.title: tricky, frustrating install
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous one (same model) and installation was easy-peasy. Not so with this one. I was an hour with tech support and paid for the $9.99 service of having them take control of my computer. Turned out the Router Extender needed a firmware upgrade. If I had opted for the free, tech support guided, manual install no telling how long it would have taken to identify the difficulty. Linksys tech support was great and realized I wasn't a complete dodo, and they checked the firmware status of my router while they were getting me all setup. Makes me wonder how long this one was sitting in the Amazon warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: P. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Using the cross band feature gives me the greatest possible speed
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my netgear C3700-100NAS cable modem router. The router is in the widow of the guest house, about 150ft out. The extender is away from the windows of the main house, so the signal has to pass through one wall. The spot finder is in the green, and the 2.4ghz signal is about 35% to 40% for the router to extender connection. The 5ghz signal to the router can't quite connect. For the connection to the router I use only the 2.4ghz band, and for devices connecting to the extender I only use the 5ghz band. Using the cross band feature gives me the greatest possible speed. Very Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: bad customer service !! posible scam
customer_reviews.text: Tried several times to get support and could not understand the tech from who knows where(India,Pakistan) I would be transferred to another department and I would pay a one time service charge? the linksys set up screen says no support fee! After several days and more attempts to get help the last tech logged on to my computer and said he would diagnose my complete system,then he said I had a problem with "internet firewall" and for $299 they had a app that would fix it and I should not buy anything on line or do any personal business until I had the app installed that he offered! sounds like a scam! Beware!
customer_reviews.author: don e enberg

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: If you can use this thing out of the box without a modification to antennas you're golden If you need to add an antenna because you're trying to use it to extend range into an old steel building, it works great as well. The antennas, that are removable, a bonus to this type of product it seems, require a Coax Adapter SMA Female to RP-SMA Male. If you need something simple that you can add a custom antenna to, THIS IS WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR
customer_reviews.author: othercompguy

customer_reviews.title: works great...now
customer_reviews.text: Directions for this extender were either wrong or hard to understand. I believe both. I have nothing but praise for Linksys tech support. But even they had problems getting this to work right. They spent about 4 hrs with me on the phone getting it to work correctly. It does work great now, much better than the wifi adapter we had before. Very happy with it now. But can't give it 5 stars because of all the trouble we had getting it set up.
customer_reviews.author: sykes

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Solved our problem. I had problems using the internet in the living room which is about 10 yards from where the router. Put this in place in the living room and have no more problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't maintain good connection. It'd vary from strong to week
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't maintain good connection. It'd vary from strong to week, sometimes loosing signal for up to an hour. It was being used in a multilevel house, so I'd understand if it couldn't get a strong signal, however once it got it, not sure why it'd loose it. Replaced it with a Google WI-FI Mesh system. Strong connection and consistent. Gave Linsys unit to another person to try at their house to see if it works for them. Has Linksys lost their edge? Hmmm
customer_reviews.author: Jet

customer_reviews.title: This extender never worked like advertised
customer_reviews.text: Well where do I start. This product has many problems. The first being the setup is not very intuitive at all. I have many years of experience with router, switch, and other network devices and this product was a pain to setup. The range was not even close to what was advertised. Connecting devices was extremely problematic and much of the time devices would just disconnect for no reason. My house is small ( >1000 sqft) and a single level and this extender had problems covering that. I also found that extender would use the same WiFi channel that the original WiFi router causing a drop in throughput. And there was no way to change the channel the extender uses.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Shears

customer_reviews.title: well worth it
customer_reviews.text: really well done, the reviews are right, I've found it to be as stable as my dt wrt builds , been up and stable on a third link for a month and never dropped, says a lot to the programmers. I highly recommend above the other crap on the market....mind this is just an extender. But for me I have an asus 68u to a 1200 running dtwrt to this and it's great. I'm using to stream security cameras and the stability was an issue with the asus builds.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Good product but does not produce the range stated
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 3,600 sq. ft. house, one story. This product states it will cover 10,000 sq. ft but I found that is not the case with the one I have/received. It's ok within about 75 feet of my router but after that I'm still using another booster.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent if you own a Linksys router!
customer_reviews.text: Went through a couple of extender units, this one linked up perfect with my Linksys router and give total strength to the family room TV, computers, smart phones and DVRs. Main router in an office upstairs in split level home. Router sits in the living room above the family room below which gets nice 5 bars of 2.5 and 5ghz! If you own a Linksys router - they will find each other the first time and fast!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Keeps losing connection.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps losing connection. Have to disconnect and reconnect power frequently. When that failed, I had to reset it to factory settings. Very frustrating 😠
customer_reviews.author: Norman B. North

customer_reviews.title: Works well but breaks down frequently
customer_reviews.text: The range extender does its job well when it works. The problem with it is, it stops working frequently - sometimes more than once a day - and has to be manually reset each time. My other quibble is that the installation instructions were incorrect, they left out the most important step. Installation is easy, but without correct instructions, you have to call customer service to be told what you actually have to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kiké Florida

customer_reviews.title: Problem units.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product in the past and it worked very good. I recently purchased two of these units and neither worked. I tried to contact their customer service several times, but wasn’t able to communicate with anyone. Called the help line from Amazon, after going through the trying to get them setup we didn’t have any luck. Return both units.
customer_reviews.author: L. M.

customer_reviews.title: WiFi range extender
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this range extender in the hopes that it would get rid of the area that my WiFi was weak. Well, it works great. The only issue that I have is that it creates a second area, when I go to that area, I must switch over to that WiFi. Not a big problem, but an annoyance just the same.
customer_reviews.author: MikesDog

customer_reviews.title: Better than Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This extender far exceeded my hopes. It was very easy to set up. It vastly improved the signal to my driveway where I hadn't been getting software updates for my Tesla. Now, I never miss a download. In addition to all of this, the device looks pretty cool. I placed it in my living room with little push back from my wife. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to extend my current network as it boast 10k sq ft of coverage. I have a two story home at around 4k sq ft. What I found is this router does not come close to covering 10k sq ft maybe 200 sq ft. I also experienced constant wifi failure and the only way to correct it was rebooting. The bottom line is I removed this router from my network as what they advertise it to do is pure bunk - this product is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: NCShopper

customer_reviews.title: Drops the signal all the time
customer_reviews.text: Used it to extend my desktop computer that didn't have wi-fi built in as well as an IP phone the needed a wired connection. Even though the signal was perfect from the wi-fi to this,, it would drop the internet connection 5-10 times a day, each time having to unplug it, or switch rj-45 jacks, pathetic. It had all the lastest updates, firmware, etc FWIW. Returned and bought a cheap Vonets VAP11G-300 for $18 and that works absolutely perfect, hasn't dropped a connection once in the 3 weeks since swapping for this hunk of junk. Don't waste your time OR your money on this!
customer_reviews.author: freddylongallstar

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. It reaches our RV spot that is about 150 feet from the booster. Easy to install but I needed to call tech support because instructions were a bit confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ok now will wait to see how long it lasts
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up has turned out to be a big disappointment, we r constantly having freeze up and have to reset this thing every day usually twice would not recomend it to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Ron Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I got a reconditioned one. Easy set-up but I did have to press the factory reset button to get it online. Otherwise, it fixed my connection problem and I moved my desktop computer to another room. Awesome speed and I don't notice any significant lag time compared being plugged directly into the router.
customer_reviews.author: Cee

customer_reviews.title: good range, poor consistency
customer_reviews.text: It was good in terms of extending the range of my home wifi, giving me 2-3 bars all the way to my neighbor's house. However, it would disconnect itself from the network several times a day without an inciting event, and would require manual reset (unplugging and replugging the power cord) to get it to connect again. Very frustrating and disappointing, especially since I finally found a powerful enough extender.
customer_reviews.author: Elaina

customer_reviews.title: 70% reliability = 30% loss of productivity
customer_reviews.text: This has proven itself to be an unreliable product. We invested in Linksys routers and 6 of these repeaters and have experienced numerous connection failures. They appear to forget/loose network connectivity names and passwords to remain connected to the routers. They also from time to time forget the individual names assigned to itself. All of which causes loss of work productivity.
customer_reviews.author: OTM Procurement

customer_reviews.title: Some pitfalls but overall a good device
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys RE6500 has it's share of problems. The original firmware is very buggy ... so deal with that first thing! This device has a mind of it's own and can revert back to previous settings for no apparent reason and once you save the settings the browser often cannot reconnect to the device without you re-opening it in a new browser tab. Because of these setup issues I almost returned this item; however, once I successfully completed the setup, this puppy worked flawlessly and continues to work flawlessly, so I find myself really digging it after all! Who knew?
customer_reviews.author: RockinRik

customer_reviews.title: Amazeballs!
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. We have 4 bars in every corner of our house and in the back yard. Despite some reviews that said it was hard to set up I got it and my husband had it set up and running within a few minutes. Money very well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I bought a different range extender and it kept losing the signal and it would take a factory reset to get it to work again. I got tired of that every couple of days so I returned it. Got another of the same thing and had the exact same problem. So I returned it and got this Linksys range extender. I'm VERY pleased with this Linksys. It has worked flawlessly since I set it up and I haven't had a moment of problems with it. I got it to extend my wifi out to my shed to control some smart plugs for my Christmas decorations. I highly recommend this Linksys range extender.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R. McGee

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless repeater
customer_reviews.text: Setup is very easy. I live in a high rise apartment and all my neighbors have Comcast. Everyone has their router on the same stock channel. I changed channel on Comcast router to 9 to avoid signal overlaps. Hit WPS on router and repeater and it was good. Repeated WPS again and it set second channel. I have wifi throughout my apartment. Building is 50 years old with very thick concrete walls. Wifi signal wasn't penetrating walls. This repeater takes care of that. Make sure you update firmware. First firmware update you have to download file from Linksys. After that update is done, all other firmware updates can be done through web interface on repeater. Definitely a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: sjcabdriver

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Third range extender with all three being different brands and prices. First one we had for years and worked great. Second one from Amazon different brand around $100 didn’t work well at all and returned. This one is just ok. Have moved it many times with new setup each time which is a pain. Doesn’t reach as far as original extender we had. Prob should have returned, but didn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Sugarrunjeep

customer_reviews.title: Think about it and then DO NOT do it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow... How is this thing even still being sold? Don't know... Step 3 in the instructions: Wait for the light to turn solid... NEVER did... Factory reset the device... Same thing... Garbage dipped in garbage... AVOID at all costs...
customer_reviews.author: Steve L

customer_reviews.title: it actually works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to support a backyard security camera that had been struggling maintaining a wifi connection. Was using a Netgear extender that could barely maintain a connection to my primary router, let alone push a signal 60' away to my backyard. The Linksys extender connected and pushed a good strong signal. Camera is up and running!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless extender, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Works well, setup is fairly easy. This is the second one I purchased and the range is good, wireless performance is good and it has the ability to use the same SSID as your router with support for both 2.4Ghz as well as 5Ghz routers. Also, it does have ethernet ports on it so that you can hard wire devices right to it. I would certainly recommend this for improving the wireless signal to the fringe areas that your existing signal is not reaching good enough.
customer_reviews.author: A. Judis

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I used it for 2 years then suddenly it died. For no reason. It also has a much poorer signal compared with those about half its price. For anyone looking to buy this: I made my mistake because I was looking for a "repeater", which technically is different from an "extender". However, nowadays whatever other "extenders" you can find on Amazon will also be a "repeater". So just buy other extenders instead.
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: ... a range extender elsewhere but this one is much better. Our signal now reaches the building that's about ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a range extender elsewhere but this one is much better. Our signal now reaches the building that's about 100 yards away on our property!! Saves us $100/month because we don't have to have a separate account for that building. Fabulous and definitely worth the $91 total we paid!!
customer_reviews.author: PattyP23

customer_reviews.title: love it, great range, very fast, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Researched for a long time to find the right wifi range extender and saw lots of good reviews for the linksys AC1200. It works really well moved it toward the back of my house to get better wifi in my bedroom, and it has made the signal soooo much better. We even get a fairly strong signal in most of our back yard now about 40-50 feet away from the house through the walls of our detached garage. Set up took me literally five minutes included my mounting it to the wall and was super simple. We are very satisfied with this purchase and are loving having fast internet all over our house and yard now.
customer_reviews.author: Nickopotomus

customer_reviews.title: Very Weak
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this booster. The output signal was very low, and it feel off quite rapidly with distance. The signal strength was often lower than my router even when the router was several rooms away. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bailen

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This product works MAYBE 10% of the time I've had it. When it works... fantastic. But I am CONSTANTLY having to reset, reconfigure, or just ignore it completely. It has literally been over a month since I've been able to get this item to work at all. This was a big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This extender replaced 3 plug in extenders through-out my home. Ended the angry thrashing of the wifi gods with calm and happiness. It got put up high on a shelf and so far it's a happy device and loved by all devices in the realm.
customer_reviews.author: T. Garner

customer_reviews.title: Range extender arrived late, but was able to start ...
customer_reviews.text: Range extender arrived late, but was able to start the setup process immediately after receiving it. Setup instructions are not really accurate. Have a NetGear router and it took several iterations to finally get the extender working. Went online and looked at U Tube to assist. Range is not what they say. We live in a 4,500 sq foot house all on one level and we only get another 15' -20' more wifi. Walls do not interfere. Would advise looking around at other products..
customer_reviews.author: Dave Simon

customer_reviews.title: I am giving this Linksys ac1200 wifu extender 3 out ...
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this Linksys ac1200 wifu extender 3 out of 5 stars because during the less than one month I have had it, it has lost connection with the 'parent' wireless router twice. A simple turning it off and on again gets it to reconnect but I shouldn't have to do that. I am beginning to think that Linksys products are starting to be junk. They sure don't make em' lije the wrtg52 series routers anymore... those things were practically bulletproof.
customer_reviews.author: Yah Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: More power, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Setup was extremely simple. I was able to retain the old password and network name. All of the users simply disconnected from the network and signed on again to reconnect. Using the high-gain antennas extended wifi access to our backyard with little signal attenuation.
customer_reviews.author: GaryP

customer_reviews.title: Does not do the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to extend the range of my modem router combination from Arris for Comcast. I had to put it 12" away from the router before it would work and only lasted about a year before it went out. I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Earl Pond III

customer_reviews.title: This USED product did not work from the start
customer_reviews.text: Waste of time. I'm a techy and I was wary of buying this product. When I received the product it had a previous tag from the last user in the package. I am sure this product is fine NEW but this particular seller just repackaged a bad product and resold it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: It increased wi-fi range
customer_reviews.text: No question, my wi-fi signal doubled as confirmed w/ app I DL'd to my cell phone. Primary router made it 80' down the hall w/ three sharp turns BUT had complete loss at the fourth sharp turn. This extender gives me a usable signal two more sharp turns and 30' outside when installed at 60' from router. Honestly, I'm pretty sure it's as simple as increasing the wattage and providing longer antennas, so all high gain extenders should not be this expensive. hat being said, it did the job.
customer_reviews.author: E Ticket

customer_reviews.title: Healhy Family Life sent wrong item
customer_reviews.text: I thought the price for the RE6500HG high gain wifi extender was almost too good to be true - they sent me the RE6500, not the high gain version. Was this just an innocent error, or bait-and-switch? I don't know for sure, but I suspect I have a good idea. I will never order anything again from "Healthy Family Life" - just not worth the frustrations.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Miner

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Old Verizon router provided full coverage but ultimately failed and had to be replaced with a new router from Frontier that did not provide adequate coverage. Brought the Linksys extender with some reservations regarding expected installation issues. These reservations were totally unjustified. Followed the instructions, setup was quick and easy. My system was up and running with full coverage as before in less than 5 min. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: FWR3

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, it does not work. Extremely easy to start the connection process. One merely plug it in. It starts blinking and is supposed to change to a solid, non flashing indicator light when connected to one's router. No matter where I placed the device it would not stop flashing. It never connected to my router. Out of frustration, I moved it to the room where my router was located. It could not find/connect to the router which was about 6 inches away. I am returning the extender and will buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to be able to use my Philips Hue lighting system in the basement where the WiFi signal is weak - it works great to relay a strong signal to every corner of the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked as advertised and resolved two issues
customer_reviews.text: I needed to extend the coverage of my wifi network to my outdoor space. Also, I had a wired network device that needed to be extended. This product did both. It saved me having to run a hardwire out to the wired device as well as it extended my wifi network. You do have to connect to the extended wifi but that hasn't been a problem. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.Lewis

customer_reviews.title: cayses sunch lockup and overloads to main unit
customer_reviews.text: causes main router to overload when initial interruptions in power ir broadband signal to require unattended resynch to the point main unit is virtually unusagle. I have a 6 antenna linksys mifi main unit that cost $300 so this lockup situation is unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: road_warrior

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects A LOT!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the first 2 months of owning it, it was just fine. Fast download/uploads, low ping and all (When using ethernet). But then, it decides that it has enough, so it keeps disconnecting when ever I play any online game for 30+ minutes (Online Modes - GTAV, Overwatch, CSGO, and more). If I'm not gaming, every 1-2 hours it disconnects. It makes me so frustrated every time I disconnect. I have to keep rebooting it
customer_reviews.author: patrice

customer_reviews.title: SET-UP FAILURE
customer_reviews.text: Would not stop blinking amber no matter what I tried. Finally got through to tech support then following her directions call dropped and she never called me back. Waited 30 minutes for her to answer first time! Another 25 minutes on phone with her and could barely hear her then after called dropped no call back so back on phone holding endlessly again. I also bought the small AC wall unit AC1200 RE6700. Will update if successful.
customer_reviews.author: Ron H. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Just after I'm able to return it
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for less than two months. Now it's constantly rebooting and causing major interruptions even to wired connections. . and here I thought I was buying a good unit. Better pick something else
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Actually is easy to setup!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box and most electronic things hate me and never work right out of the box, especially wifi things. When they says easy to setup, they mean it.
customer_reviews.author: EDH

customer_reviews.title: Stronger Signals Measured.
customer_reviews.text: I installed a Linksys AC 1200 Max Wi-Fi Range Extender to strengthen the signal of my router at the northern end of my house. It took my signal on my iPhone from about 7 mbps to 60mbps! I expect my wife's phone and computer will enjoy similar results. Her computer had a problem with losing a network connection. I think we've solved that problem.
customer_reviews.author: George Miller

customer_reviews.title: I gave it a go
customer_reviews.text: I believe one of the channels doesn't work and I really don't have the mind to reconfigure this, or whatever I must do. In addition, I'm not certain it really does the job as my son in the furthest bedroom still has difficulty connecting.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Masullo

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Crashing, waste of time & money
customer_reviews.text: In the olden days, the blue Linksys wi-fi equipment was a guaranty for quality and seamless wi-fi. Not anymore! I have Linksys router ( EA 7500e) and had to buy an extender to cover 110 m2 flat. The extender came in a brown box, so I assume it was refurbished. It has to be restarted every 2 hours. Last piece of Linksys equipment that I will ever buy. Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.author: Tome Pavleski

customer_reviews.title: It works! This is the WiFi extender to buy!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a WiFi extender that works! I had one room that I never could cover with WiFi and cheap extenders. Then I tried this product and problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Frank J. Pemberton

customer_reviews.title: ... has 4 floors and I could never get a good connection 3 floors away from router
customer_reviews.text: My house has 4 floors and I could never get a good connection 3 floors away from router. The extender changed all that. Great product that will boost your Internet tremendously
customer_reviews.author: Judith Digiano

customer_reviews.title: Linksys is junk!  Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Worthless, set it up get everything working and the next day nothing recognizes it. It won’t even link to amazon fire stick a few feet away consistently much less something within the eztreems of the 10,000 square feet range.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Linksys AC1200 worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This wi-fi extender met expectations admirably. It's a bit higher priced than others & was easy enough to set up (despite some comments to the contrary) but definitely worth the money. I'm using an ASUS dual band router that's pretty good but wasn't able to penetrate some of our walls (19th construction with thick plaster over metal lathe). I can now access the internet throughout my house.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Rhoads

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one
customer_reviews.text: I was using the extender a few minutes after taking it out of the box, and it works incredibly well, solving my "dead spot" problems once and for all. I don't understand why other users had problems. If all tech products were this easy to set up and worked this well our lives would be a lot simpler. Disclaimer: I have no interest, financial or otherwise, in Linksys or its products.
customer_reviews.author: Erstwhile

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: Received product promptly and followed directions that were provided in box. I utilized my iPhone to complete connection after an initial 1 min search for a signal. After logging into suggested website, I was able to complete the steps within minutes. Upon completion I checked the area that had recently had poor service and had 2 additional bars (full coverage). It is working as advertised and adding additional coverage to garage and outdoor space.
customer_reviews.author: Darice A Stroebel

customer_reviews.title: This wifi extender needs extender for itself
customer_reviews.text: It claims 10,000 sq feet of coverage area but it hardly covers a 100 sq feet. Its better to go with old router laying in your basement or from goodwill to get wifi coverage in your backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Pradip

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't connect!
customer_reviews.text: We spent two hours trying to connect this repeater and it didn't work. It is exteremely finicky and you apparently need to find some specific spot in the mid-air where it will decide to work. Troubleshooting instructions aren't helpful. We are returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Alx77

customer_reviews.title: Linksys never disappoints
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best router I have ever had. I have a concrete block home with 3700 square feet. I do lose ATT Micro Cell signal in garage (which is not part of the home square footage). Oh well maybe an extender will help. Otherwise, checking out Verizon for cellular service.
customer_reviews.author: naplesguy

customer_reviews.title: Set up was a breeze and full signal strength throughout 3 floor home!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and very easy to set up. Not sure about the other people who complained about their set up experience. So happy I went with this model. Set up took less than 10 minutes, with most of the time spent keying in our modem password. Our dual band modem signals were hindered by basement location, but now we get maximum signals on the 3rd floor!!
customer_reviews.author: milehibones

customer_reviews.title: No good w/ tengonet
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work, won't work with tengonet, can't recognize router. Tengonet won't ppass on info to connect even tho they recommended extender for difficult locations. We are 500 ft from park antenna, gotta use cell hotspot!! Not for rver's
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: for me it didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: it drops out of the network at least once a week and have to unplug and plug back in to connect to the nw. also, at for me is not increase the signal anymore than the strength I get connecting to router wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: Amable Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Severely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product is terrible. It worked for the first two weeks great. Now cuts in and out constantly. I can no longer get a fat signal through it. My main router consistently sends a strong signal. I tried to work with their customer services for several hours and their only answer was my internet provider was bad. False. I’ve had bad experiences with Linksys before and they continued their legacy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit and it did not connect. I called Customer service and waited forever, finally I was connected to someone whom was not helpful who cut me off after 45 min, I called back waited 40 min. the young lady told me I was talking to the wrong Dept. I would like to finish this story but I'm still on the phone waiting to get connected to the proper dept. NO NOT buy linksys
customer_reviews.author: Randall Kalstrom

customer_reviews.title: wifi extender
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy the more expensive version with the high gain antennas. Get this and then buy the $9 high gain antennas. Saved me $50 and works great.
customer_reviews.author: MGC

customer_reviews.title: I initially thought this thing didn't wok, but in fact it works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It really messed with my head though. Other range extenders output a signal that is seen as a alternate WiFi connection. This extender, used with a Linksys AC 1900 Router, literally extends the same WiFi signal. No need to sign on to multiple selections, just obtain the ability to move much further from your central router seamlessly. I initially thought this thing didn't wok, but in fact it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B.

customer_reviews.title: Fragile Antenna
customer_reviews.text: Careful, the cheap "high gain" antenna is very fragile. Broke while I was screwing them in... before I even turned the unit on. The "high gain" didn't seem to add any signal strength at all, don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: jamesb007

customer_reviews.title: was very easy to set up with the following instructions and eithernet ...
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys Ac1200 Gigabite range extender . was very easy to set up with the following instructions and eithernet cable that were provided with the extender. and a computer that was not included. one of the other features that was included with the router that i found that was awsome . You can plug speakers into the router and use it as a wireless speaker system
customer_reviews.author: Chris T. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Drops signals like mad....
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay when we first got it setup but after a few months started dropping signals like crazy when nothing had changed. It's now become pretty unreliable and will need to be replaced. Certainly won't be replacing it with the same model.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing extender, but beware of wireless set-up
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd extender I’ve tried, finally something that works! I’m about 60 ft away from our router in a guest suite across the backyard, I thought decent WiFi was a lost cause. Be careful if you’re using a wireless set-up, it’s not intuitive and was very finicky (I couldn’t get it to work.) However, it works wonders with the Ethernet set-up. My speed went from 5-10 mbps to about 80 mbps. It’s not perfect, but it’s a HUGE improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My upstairs computer was about twenty five feet away, ...
customer_reviews.text: My upstairs computer was about twenty five feet away, and not a direct line of sight from the downstairs Mac airport. Signal strength hit and miss. Followed the instructions that came with the AC1220. Probably doubled or more my download speed.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Updates suck.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says.Connects ok but.rubbish wesite.rubbish manual. Rubbish updates.impossible to install firmware. Range is ok. Depends where you place it. Runs very hot.very hot!not as strong as would was led to believe but that said when in correct position connection works.returned it. Going for a netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Zipper

customer_reviews.title: No Go
customer_reviews.text: I thought the Linksys brand would get better when Cisco bought the company, but it hasn't happened. It works, but I have to reboot it every few months to get the signal strength back. (Same old Linksys issue). Remember when you use a repeater, even if you have signal, your bandwidth will be significantly reduced.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: got this to extend my wifi to the far reaches of the house. Was skeptical but it works great. Granddaughter room is no longer a dead spot. She is happy so gumppa is happy!
customer_reviews.author: Stan from Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend. I'm an Apple fan
customer_reviews.text: Can't recommend. I'm an Apple fan. Thinking these goofy looking antennas would really boost my Apple AirPlay quality I purchased this. No matter how I hooked up this range extender (WI-FI or hard wired ethernet) no matter where I located it within in my house, it never achieved any better signal than my Apple AirPort Express router/extender. If your looking for Apple AirPlay, stay with Apple Routers.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great product and customer service !
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service ! Thank you guys for ensuring my satisfaction, This is the product you want and Linksys is who you want to buy from.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal and great range
customer_reviews.text: This Linksys router superceded my expectations. I currently have a wireless router on the opposite end of the office and was unable to connect if you sit at the other end of the office. Now with the extender the signal is reachable on all 12,000 square feet of our office floor as well as in our upstairs office lobby. Setting up this device was very quick and easy, instructions are very easy to follow and would highly recommend this product. I've placed an order for two more of these routers for our offices lower lobbies.
customer_reviews.author: Enterprising One

customer_reviews.title: Did not recognize a Netgear router and was returned
customer_reviews.text: Could not get it to recognize an older Netgear router and I returned it to Amazon for credit on my account.
customer_reviews.author: SC Gator

customer_reviews.title: Has issues period
customer_reviews.text: This piece of hardware did not ever want to stay connected to the network for one reason or another did trouble shoot multiple times and found all things on my network was running up to speed it was very frustrating time and time again will never purchase anything from linksys again .....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great help
customer_reviews.text: We needed to extend our wifi into the parking lot of our business during COVID-19 and this did the trick. No regrets!
customer_reviews.author: Sue123

customer_reviews.title: Resulted in loss of wifi speed
customer_reviews.text: Anyone thinking of getting one of these to extend their wifi range should get a mesh network router instead. Installing two to these to my network resulted in cutting my wifi speed in half. I wound up replacing everything with one of the new mesh network systems (Orbi) and I can now stream video into my garage without the annoying buffering I got with the extender.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Big

customer_reviews.title: Great for laptops/PS4/Xbox, not so for desktop
customer_reviews.text: Made a difference for our laptop and my brother's console games but not much for my desktop. So if you need it for either laptop or Xbox/PS4 I would definitely recommend. However if you need it for desktop or online gaming, then I would skip this and just buy an ethernet cable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do new update
customer_reviews.text: Bought this two years ago and conveniently after the service support ends, it refuses to perform. Using the extender my range performance goes from 90mbps to 25Mbps making it completely useless. My router is better. (Don’t worry I did the most recent firmware update from June 2020 but maybe that’s the exact issue and they pulled an Apple on us)
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, needs better instructions!
customer_reviews.text: The extender works great once you figure out how to get it working. Instructions need a rewrite! If I had not known a little about networking, I don’t think I could have got it to work with tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Shelnut

customer_reviews.title: which sucks because pretty much the whole reason I bought it ...
customer_reviews.text: This wireless Wi-Fi range extender disconnected every time I tried to watch anything on YouTube, which sucks because pretty much the whole reason I bought it was so I could watch stuff in my room. The connection also went out about every 30-45 minutes, which made it pretty much impossible to do anything. Two stars because Linksys's range extender setup website actually exists (unlike Netgear).
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Extender is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy set-up with this version. My kids Fire Stick & X-Box in the back of our home had spotty coverage. Once hooked up the internet was extremely fast. It names itself after your Wifi with Ext on the end so you know which one to connect to. The coverage is excellent on my back patio. I have a Linksys router so the Linksys Smart Wi-Fi app also picks up any devices connected to the Linksys Extender
customer_reviews.author: KayTee

product_meta.title: Linksys (RE6500HG-FFP) AC1200 Max Wi-Fi Gigabit Range Extender / Repeater with High-Gain Antennas
product_meta.description: Model:AC1200 High-GainUsing the Linksys range extender Max, You can easily extend the range of your existing wireless Router to create a strong Wi-Fi signal for all the devices in and around your home, including smartphones, tablets, Ultra books, and more. The RE6500 extends the wireless coverage area by up to 10, 000 square feet to eliminate dead zones. Greater coverage allows you to enjoy fast Wi-Fi speeds on your laptop or tablet-even if you're outside on the patio or in the backyard. Thanks to high-speed Wireless-AC technology, the RE6500 creates Wi-Fi speeds that are up to three times faster than Wireless-N. You also get double the channel bandwidth, with 80MHz wide channels providing more room for more data to flow faster than ever. With this extra speed, you can stream HD-quality videos and play online games seamlessly without interruptions or lag. The RE6500 features simultaneous dual bands, which means it transmits at both The 2. 4GHz and 5GHz frequencies at the same time. It extends 2. 4 and 5GHz Wi-Fi up to N300 Mbps + AC867 Mbps and reduces interference. So no matter which band your wireless devices use, they'll automatically connect to the best available band for the fastest possible performance.
feature_bullets: Fast Ethernet port for wired devices such as Blu ray players, game consoles, and more
Eliminate WiFi dead zones in your home and expands coverage better HD streaming, gaming, and more
Four gigabit ethernet ports for wired devices such as Blu ray players, game consoles, and more
Extend the range of 4 wired devices to ensure uninterrupted media streaming and sast data transfer; simple installation requires no CD to institute
Works with all Wi Fi routers or isp supplied gateways
Expand Wi Fi coverage upto 10, 000 square feet
Two high gain antennas amplify the Wi-Fi signal strength throughout your home
Easy setup with push button connect
Guides you to the best placement in your home with Spot finder technology
Connect your speakers through the built-in audio jack to wirelessly stream music

specifications.Operating System: Microsoft Windows XP SP3, Windows Vista SP1 or later, Windows 7, or Windows 8 operating system or the Mac OS X Leopard 10.5.8 or later, Snow Leopard 10.6.1 or later, Lion 10.7 or later, or Mountain Lion 10.8 or later operating system.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars1,136 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
